mil.emp3.api.interfaces

Interface ILookAt

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoAltitudeMode, org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoBase, org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoLookAt, org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoPosition
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LookAt

    public interface ILookAt
extends org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoLookAt
    This class defines the interface to a lookAt.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoAltitudeMode

        org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoAltitudeMode.AltitudeMode

    • Method Summary

      This method adds an event listener to the LookAt.

      This method causes any changes done to the LookAt settings to be applied to any map or object that it may be associated with.

    • Method Detail

      • copySettingsFrom

        void copySettingsFrom(ILookAt from)
        This method copies all settings from the LookAt object provided. The settings copied are the coordinates, altitude, altitude mode, tilt, roll, range and azimuth.
        Parameters:
        from - An object that implements the ILookAt interface.

      • addLookAtEventListener

        EventListenerHandle addLookAtEventListener(ILookAtEventListener listener)
                                           throws EMP_Exception
        This method adds an event listener to the LookAt.
        Parameters:
        listener - A reference to a class object that implements the ILookAtEventListener interface.
        Returns:
        The handle to the event registration. See EventListenerHandle
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the listener is null.

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(EventListenerHandle hListener)
        This method must be used to remove the registration from the system.
        Parameters:
        hListener - The handle returned by the call to addLookAtEventListener. See EventListenerHandle

      • apply

        void apply(boolean animate)
        This method causes any changes done to the LookAt settings to be applied to any map or object that it may be associated with.
        Parameters:
        animate - If set to true then camera movement will be animated.
